info.title: Hawkings Education Data API
info.description: API para la generación de actividades (audio-resume, diagram, expand, etc.) de la plataforma Hawkings Education. La autenticación se realiza mediante la cabecera **X-API-KEY**.

UnauthorizedError.description: Error de autenticación (Sin API KEY, API KEY no existente, Usuario no activo, etc.)

example.message: Authentication failed: missing or invalid API KEY.
The requested activity is no longer available

ValidationError.description: Error en la validación de los datos

example.message: The count field must be an integer.

messages.integer: The count field must be an integer.

data.title: Short Answer Evaluation for Advertising 101
data.description: Evaluate the accuracy and relevance of a short answer given by the student

example.title: Text Summary for Advertising 101
example.description: Read a text and draft a concise summary with the main ideas

content.summary: La evolución de la comunicación persuasiva ... (texto recortado)
conclusions: The evolution of advertising has progressed from oral announcements to written and visual forms, reflecting societal and technological advancements.
Early advertising methods, including graffiti and town criers, laid the foundation for the modern advertising we see today, with many techniques having roots in ancient practices.
The printing press was a pivotal invention that enabled mass dissemination of messages.

main_points.title: The Printing Press Revolution
main_points.details: Johannes Gutenberg's invention of the printing press in the fifteenth century revolutionized communication, allowing for the exponential multiplication of messages and the creation of almanacs with advertising elements.

main_points.title: Early Forms of Written Advertising
main_points.details: In ancient Greece, propaganda media such as axons and kyrbos were used, while ancient Rome employed 'alba' and 'libelli' for official and commercial communication. Graffiti also served as a medium for protest and commercial messaging.

main_points.title: Evolution of Visual Advertising
main_points.details: Posterism gained strength as a method of message dissemination, promoting shows or military enlistment. Posters evolved to incorporate new typographies and text alignment. Labelling emerged as a method to identify and differentiate products.

main_points.title: Oral Advertising in Ancient Times
main_points.details: Persuasive communication was initially oral, with merchants loudly advertising products. Town criers and heralds were early examples.

example.title: Audio Summary for Advertising 101
example.description: Listen to an audio clip and produce a concise summary of its content

content.summary: This text outlines the historical development of advertising ... (texto recortado)

example.title: Evolution of Early Advertising
example.description: A diagram showing the evolution of early advertising methods and technologies.

content.title: Evolution of Early Advertising
content.description: A diagram showing the evolution of early advertising methods and technologies.

example.title: Content Expansion for Advertising 101
example.description: Expand or detail the provided information for better understanding

context.theoretical: This content touches on the evolution of communication ... (texto recortado)

other_fields.connection: The history of advertising is fundamentally intertwined with modern marketing practices.
Early printed materials were used for political campaigns and propaganda.
Advertising influences societal values, consumer behavior, and social trends.
Advertising and its history provide insights into the economic, social, and technological development.

connections.current_debates: Ongoing discussions center around the ethical implications of advertising...

perspectives.key_points: Emphasizes the role of social factors...
Examines how cultural meanings influence advertising...

expansion.advanced_aspects: Further study could look at psychological effects...

related_concepts.relevance: Explains the transition enabled by the printing press.
related_concepts.explanation: The printing press allowed a single message to reach a large audience.
Propaganda and advertising share techniques, though with different aims.

related_concepts.relevance: Analyzes how visual elements enhance messages.
related_concepts.explanation: Posters and labels are clear examples.

related_concepts.relevance: Marks the early steps towards product identity.
related_concepts.explanation: Labels and signs led to the era of brands.

related_concepts.relevance: Foundations in rhetoric and public speaking.
related_concepts.explanation: Town criers and heralds are early examples.

example.title: Detailed Explanation for Advertising 101
example.description: Offer a detailed explanation of a concept or text fragment

explanation.summary: Advertising evolved from simple spoken announcements ... (texto recortado)

examples.scenario: A town crier shouting about new products in the market.
examples.relevance: Shows the earliest form of oral advertising.

examples.scenario: Graffiti in ancient Rome mentioning brothels.
Early newspapers using printing presses to announce new products.
examples.relevance: Illustrates the mass production enabled by the printing press.

examples.scenario: Sergeant inviting people to join the army with offers of drinks
examples.relevance: Shows the use of persuasive tactics.

main_analogy.comparison: Like how a tiny seed grows into a big tree...
main_analogy.explanation: Advertising started basic and became more complex.

core_concept.simple_definition: Advertising started as simple methods to inform about products...

progressive_structure.main_idea: Advertising has a long history that started with oral communication...
progressive_structure.relationships: Oral methods evolved into written and then printed forms.

key_components.explanation: Earliest form where products were announced loudly.
Started with signs, graffiti, and basic writings.
The printing press allowed mass production of advertising materials.
Techniques to influence buyer behavior evolved over time.

example.title: Flashcards for Advertising 101
example.description: Review key concepts through 3 flashcards

flashcards.front: What invention in the 15th century revolutionized communication and allowed for the mass dissemination of messages?
flashcards.back: The printing press, invented by Johannes Gutenberg, revolutionized communication by enabling the exponential multiplication of messages.

metadata.misconceptions: Attributing the invention of the printing press to a later date.
metadata.learning_strategy: Use mnemonics to remember key historical figures.
metadata.real_world_application: The printing press paved the way for modern mass media and advertising.

flashcards.front: How was commercial information disseminated in ancient times before the printing press, and what are some examples?
flashcards.back: Before the printing press, information was spread through oral channels (town criers, merchants) and written forms (axons/kyrbos, alba/libelli, graffiti).

metadata.misconceptions: Believing advertising is a purely modern phenomenon.
metadata.learning_strategy: Compare and contrast different ancient advertising methods.
metadata.real_world_application: Recognizing that some methods have persisted over time.

flashcards.front: Analyze how the use of oral communication for advertising evolved from the town crier to the 'charlatan'.
flashcards.back: Initially, town criers announced products, which later evolved to charlatans using persuasive language to entice buyers.

prerequisites: Understanding the role of town criers
metadata.misconceptions: Thinking advertising was always purely persuasive.
metadata.learning_strategy: Consider the techniques used to persuade the audience.

example.title: activity.quiz_mixed.title
example.description: activity.quiz_mixed.description

options: Johannes Gutenberg
Leonardo da Vinci
Michelangelo
Nicolaus Copernicus
questions.question: Who is credited with the invention of the printing press in the fifteenth century according to the content?
questions.explanation: Johannes Gutenberg is identified in the text as the inventor who revolutionized communication by creating the printing press.

options: It allowed for exponential dissemination of messages and knowledge.
It enabled the development of digital media.
It was used exclusively for religious texts.
It replaced the need for town criers entirely.
questions.question: What was a major effect of the printing press mentioned in the content?
questions.explanation: The text explains that the printing press exponentially increased the spread of messages and knowledge and paved the way for advertising through printed media.

questions.question: Scenario: Imagine you're a historian examining the transformation of advertising over centuries. Based on the content, analyze how the shift from oral advertising and ancient signboards to the printed media (like almanacs and posters) influenced modern marketing strategies.
questions.explanation: This answer connects historical methods like oral and early printed advertising to modern practices, demonstrating how foundational elements of message dissemination and visual strategy have evolved to shape contemporary marketing.
questions.correct_answer: The evolution from oral advertising to printed media was a pivotal development in communication history. Initially, information was spread through oral means and rudimentary signs, which were limited in reach and consistency. The invention of the printing press allowed for mass production of texts and images, ensuring that messages were disseminated more widely and uniformly. This not only democratized access to knowledge but also introduced fundamental advertising strategies such as brand differentiation, visual appeal through typography and layout, and repetition to reinforce messages. These early innovations laid the groundwork for today's multi-channel marketing approaches, where both visual and textual elements remain crucial in brand communication.

questions.question: Discuss the role of 'charlatans' and 'town criers' in the development of persuasive communication...
questions.model_answer: Charlatans and town criers played a crucial role in the early development of persuasive communication...
evaluation_criteria: Describe the role of town criers in disseminating information.

example.question: How did the invention of the printing press revolutionize communication and the development of advertising, and what were some of its initial limitations?
example.model_answer: The printing press revolutionized communication by enabling the mass production of messages...
example.student_response: The invention of the printing press made it possible to produce messages in large quantities...

example.title: Prueba para Advertising 101
example.description: Prueba generada con 3 preguntas

options: Printing press
Lithography machine
Telegraph
Woodblock press
questions.question: Which invention in the fifteenth century is credited with revolutionizing communication by enabling the mass production of texts, including early forms of advertising?
questions.explanation: Johannes Gutenberg's invention of the printing press allowed texts to be produced exponentially, paving the way for early advertising and mass communication.

options: It enabled the mass production of almanacs that included advertising elements for a wider audience.
It was used exclusively by the Church to spread religious messages, leaving no room for commercial content.
It focused solely on political propaganda without any impact on commercial product promotion.
It completely replaced the oral tradition of advertising by eliminating any form of spoken communication.
questions.question: How did the advent of the printing press contribute to the evolution of advertising in its early days?
questions.explanation: The printing press allowed for the creation of materials like almanacs that contained advertisements, thus expanding the reach of promotional messages and initiating concepts similar to modern advertising.

options: Oral announcements by town criers and merchants
Hand-painted axons and signboards
Graffiti on public walls
Repurposed papyrus notices like the alba and libelli
questions.question: Which method of communication was primarily used in ancient times for persuasive, commercial advertising before the advent of print media?
questions.explanation: Before print media became widespread, merchants and town criers used persuasive oral communication to advertise products, relying on compelling speeches and live announcements.

evaluation.question: How did the advent of the printing press contribute to the evolution of advertising in its early days?

assessment.feedback: Your response misattributes the use of the printing press to exclusively religious messages, missing its role in enabling the mass production of advertising content such as almanacs with commercial messages.
assessment.suggestions: Review how the printing press enabled broader commercial communication beyond its initial religious use.
missing_concepts: advertising elements reaching a wider audience

evaluation.model_answer: It enabled the mass production of almanacs that included advertising elements for a wider audience.
evaluation.student_response: It was used exclusively by the Church to spread religious messages, leaving no room for commercial content.

evaluation.question: How did the advent of the printing press contribute to the evolution of advertising in its early days?
evaluation.model_answer: It enabled the mass production of almanacs that included advertising elements for a wider audience.
evaluation.student_response: It was used exclusively by the Church to spread religious messages, leaving no room for commercial content.

assessment.feedback: Your answer incorrectly states that the printing press was used solely for religious purposes, missing the key development of advertising through mass-produced almanacs.
assessment.suggestions: Review how the printing press transitioned from exclusive religious use to generating commercial advertising through printed materials.

get.description: Obtiene una lista de contenidos asociados a un curso. Se debe enviar al menos uno de los siguientes parámetros: `course_remote_id`, `course_section_remote_id` o `course_module_remote_id`. Los parámetros `contents` (boolean), `limit` (por defecto 100) y `page` son opcionales.

parameters.name: course_remote_id
parameters.description: Identificador remoto del curso (al menos uno de estos parámetros es obligatorio)

parameters.name: course_section_remote_id
parameters.description: Identificador remoto de la sección del curso (al menos uno de estos parámetros es obligatorio)

parameters.name: course_module_remote_id
parameters.description: Identificador remoto del módulo del curso (al menos uno de estos parámetros es obligatorio)

parameters.name: contents
parameters.description: Indica si se deben incluir los contenidos completos.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Número máximo de registros a devolver (por defecto 100)

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Número de página para la paginación
